name: Electric Vehicle Data
title: Electric Vehicle Data

api_list.name: /dataListIndex
api_list.description: The 'dataListIndex' endpoint in the 'ElectricVehicleData' API provides an array of strings containing all the possible values for the 'dataListIndex' field. These values signify specific data indices related to electric vehicles. The 'dataListIndex' essentially represents unique identifiers or references for various types of information related to electric vehicles.By accessing this endpoint, developers can retrieve a comprehensive list of available 'dataListIndex' values, which can be used for referencing and retrieving specific sets of electric vehicle data. These values are essential for navigating through the API and pinpointing specific information about electric vehicles stored in the system.Users can expect to find a range of numeric values within the array, each representing a distinct data index. These indices can be related to diverse aspects of electric vehicles, such as vehicle specifications, charging information, performance metrics, or historical data.

api_list.name: /model
api_list.description: The 'model' endpoint in the ElectricVehicleData API provides a collection of strings that represent various models of electric vehicles. These models depict the different types or versions of electric cars available. For example, the endpoint may return values such as 'MODEL 3', 'MODEL X', or 'MODEL S'. The purpose of this endpoint is to give users a comprehensive list of all the possible electric vehicle models that can be found in the API's database.By accessing this endpoint, developers or users can obtain an array of these model names, which can be useful for different purposes. For instance, it enables users to filter or search for specific electric vehicle models of interest. The endpoint ensures convenience and efficiency by providing a consolidated and up-to-date list of electric vehicle models, enabling users to access this information programmatically without the need for manual research or maintenance.

api_list.name: /city
api_list.description: The 'city' endpoint from the ElectricVehicleData API provides a list of city names as an array of strings. This endpoint is valuable for users seeking information related to electric vehicles in specific cities. By querying this endpoint, users can obtain all the possible values for the 'city' field, enabling them to explore various electric vehicle-related data specific to different cities.For instance, if a user wants to understand electric vehicle adoption in different urban areas, they can request the 'city' endpoint to obtain a comprehensive list of cities covered by the API. This information can be useful for analyzing trends, comparing electric vehicle infrastructure, or even planning routes for electric vehicle trips. With the 'city' endpoint, users can easily access a wide range of city names without having to manually search or compile this information from various sources.

api_list.name: /state
api_list.description: The 'state' endpoint in the 'ElectricVehicleData' API provides you with a list of possible values for the 'state' field. This field represents the state in which an electric vehicle is located. It returns an array of strings, each string indicating a different state value.By using this endpoint, you can easily fetch a comprehensive list of all the states available for electric vehicle data in a single request. Instead of manually searching for all the possible state values, you can rely on this endpoint to provide you with a complete and up-to-date list.Whether you are building an application that requires state information for electric vehicles or conducting data analysis, this endpoint simplifies the process of obtaining accurate and consistent state values. It saves you time and effort, ensuring that your applications or analyses are always using the correct state information for electric vehicles.

api_list.name: /records
api_list.description: The 'records' endpoint is the heart of the ElectricVehicleData API. It serves as the primary gateway for users to access valuable information related to their query parameters. When making a request to this endpoint, users receive an array of objects that contain relevant data in row format.By utilizing the 'records' endpoint, users gain insights and detailed records associated with the specific query parameters they provide. The returned array of objects presents information in a user-friendly manner, allowing individuals to easily interpret and analyze the data.This endpoint acts as a powerful tool for users interested in exploring electric vehicle-related data. Whether users are conducting research, seeking statistical information, or simply curious about specific aspects of electric vehicles, the 'records' endpoint provides them with crucial and accessible data.With its extensive array of records, this endpoint empowers users by enabling them to make informed decisions, identify trends, and draw valuable conclusions from the data provided. The 'records' endpoint acts as a bridge connecting users to a wealth of knowledge related to electric vehicles, ultimately facilitating a deeper understanding of this innovative and sustainable mode of transportation.

api_list.name: /electricUtility
api_list.description: The 'electricUtility' endpoint of the 'ElectricVehicleData' API provides a user-friendly way to obtain an array of strings representing different electric utility companies. These companies supply electricity for charging electric vehicles. Each string value in the array corresponds to a specific electric utility company.For example, electric utility companies such as Puget Sound Energy Inc, City of Tacoma, City of Seattle, Bonneville Power Administration, Avista Corp, and Inland Power & Light Company may be included in the array. However, these are just a few examples, and the endpoint provides a comprehensive list of all possible electric utility companies.By accessing this endpoint, users can retrieve the names of electric utility companies to which electric vehicle charging stations may be affiliated. This information can be utilized for various purposes, such as for mapping charging station locations or analyzing charging patterns across different utility providers.

api_list.name: /county
api_list.description: The 'county' endpoint from the ElectricVehicleData API provides a valuable array of strings containing all the possible values for the field 'county'. This endpoint aims to simplify and streamline the access to information related to counties. It enables users to retrieve an extensive list of county names associated with various functionalities within the API. By utilizing this endpoint, developers can ensure accuracy and consistency when dealing with county-related data. Whether it's for mapping, statistical analysis, or any other purpose, having access to a comprehensive list of county names can greatly enhance the efficiency and accuracy of your application. From popular counties like King or Spokane to numerous others, this endpoint allows you to explore and utilize the county data effortlessly.

api_list.name: /baseMsrp
api_list.description: The 'baseMsrp' endpoint in the ElectricVehicleData API provides a user-friendly way to access a collection of possible values for the field 'baseMsrp'. 'baseMsrp' represents the base Manufacturer's Suggested Retail Price for electric vehicles. This endpoint returns an array of strings, wherein each string represents a distinct value for the 'baseMsrp' field.By accessing this endpoint, users can obtain various base MSRP values that have been set for electric vehicles. These values are essential in understanding the pricing range for different electric vehicle models. However, the specific values for this endpoint cannot be provided as they may vary depending on the data available in the API.In summary, the 'baseMsrp' endpoint in the ElectricVehicleData API allows users to retrieve a range of potential base MSRP values for electric vehicles, enabling them to gather valuable insights regarding pricing for different electric vehicle models.

api_list.name: /cleanAlternativeFuelVehicle
api_list.description: The 'cleanAlternativeFuelVehicle' endpoint from the 'ElectricVehicleData' API provides a list of possible values for the 'cleanAlternativeFuelVehicle' field. This field relates to the eligibility of vehicles being classified as clean alternative fuel vehicles. Clean alternative fuel vehicles typically refer to vehicles that run on fuels other than traditional gasoline or diesel, such as electric, hybrid, or hydrogen-powered vehicles.By utilizing this endpoint, developers can obtain an array of strings that represent the various eligibility statuses associated with clean alternative fuel vehicles. The values returned could include descriptors like 'Clean Alternative Fuel Vehicle Eligible' or 'Eligibility unknown as battery range has not been researched.' These values help users understand the eligibility criteria for clean alternative fuel vehicles within an application or system.This endpoint is essential for applications or platforms that deal with electric vehicle data, enabling them to provide accurate and up-to-date information about the eligibility of vehicles categorized as clean alternative fuel vehicles.

api_list.name: /postalCode
api_list.description: The 'postalCode' endpoint of the ElectricVehicleData API returns a list of valid postal codes. A postal code is a numerical code used by postal services to identify specific regions or areas. This endpoint provides an array of strings, each representing a different postal code. These codes are essential for locating specific addresses or areas, especially when it comes to electric vehicle data.By using this endpoint, developers can retrieve all the possible values for the 'postalCode' field, enabling them to gather relevant information related to electric vehicles based on specific regions. This data can assist in analyzing trends, conducting research, or providing tailored services based on geographical location.For instance, if an application needed to filter electric vehicle data based on postal codes, this endpoint would help retrieve an exhaustive list of valid codes. Developers can then use these codes to refine search results, identify charging station availability, or analyze energy consumption patterns, catering to specific regions as needed.By utilizing the 'postalCode' endpoint, developers can enhance their applications with accurate and comprehensive information related to the electric vehicle landscape across various postal code areas.

api_list.name: /legislativeDistrict
api_list.description: The 'legislativeDistrict' endpoint from the 'ElectricVehicleData' API provides a user-friendly way to retrieve information about legislative districts related to electric vehicles. This endpoint returns an array of strings that represent the possible values for the 'legislativeDistrict' field. Legislative districts play a significant role in the governance and policy-making process, particularly in relation to electric vehicles. By utilizing this endpoint, users can access a list of unique identifiers that correspond to different legislative districts. These identifiers can be numeric or alphanumeric, enabling users to identify and categorize specific legislative districts associated with electric vehicles.This information can be valuable for various purposes, such as statistical analysis, policy research, or understanding the geographic distribution of electric vehicle-related legislation. Developers and researchers can use the endpoint's output to enhance their applications or studies by aligning data with specific legislative districts and evaluating the impact of regulations or initiatives in different areas.In conclusion, the 'legislativeDistrict' endpoint serves as a user-friendly means to retrieve all the possible values for the 'legislativeDistrict' field, aiding in the exploration and analysis of electric vehicle-related legislative data.

api_list.name: /electricVehicleType
api_list.description: The 'electricVehicleType' endpoint of the 'ElectricVehicleData' API provides a user-friendly way to retrieve a list of all the possible values for the 'electricVehicleType' field. This field represents the different types of electric vehicles available in the dataset. By calling this endpoint, you will receive an array of strings that represents the various electric vehicle types present in the dataset.The array of strings will contain unique values that categorize electric vehicles according to their specific type. Each string represents a distinct electric vehicle type, such as Hybrid Electric Vehicle (HEV), Plug-in Hybrid Electric Vehicle (PHEV), or Fuel Cell Electric Vehicle (FCEV). These electric vehicle types play a significant role in understanding the diverse range of electric vehicles present in the data.By utilizing this endpoint, users can easily access and utilize these electric vehicle types to gain insights or perform analysis on specific types of electric vehicles. The 'electricVehicleType' endpoint helps streamline the process of retrieving comprehensive electric vehicle type information from the dataset in a simple and effective manner.

api_list.name: /vin
api_list.description: The 'vin' endpoint in the 'ElectricVehicleData' API provides valuable information about the Vehicle Identification Number (VIN) for electric vehicles. A VIN is a unique identifier assigned to each vehicle, containing a combination of letters and numbers. This endpoint returns an array of strings that represent all the possible values for the VIN field.By accessing this endpoint, users can retrieve a comprehensive list of valid VINs associated with electric vehicles. These VINs serve as essential identifiers for individual vehicles, providing data about the manufacturer, model, and other specific details related to the electric vehicle.The 'vin' endpoint can be utilized by various applications, such as vehicle history reports, fleet management systems, or electric vehicle databases. It helps developers and users access accurate and descriptive information about electric vehicles by browsing through the array of VINs returned.Please note that the example values (e.g., 5YJ3E1EA6K, 7SAXCBE52N, 5YJ3E1EAXH) mentioned above are only for illustrative purposes and not part of the actual description of the 'vin' endpoint.

api_list.name: /CensusTract
api_list.description: The 'CensusTract' endpoint in the 'ElectricVehicleData' API allows you to retrieve an array of strings containing the possible values for the 'CensusTract' field. A Census Tract is a geographical area defined by the U.S. Census Bureau for the purpose of organizing and collecting demographic data. By using this endpoint, you can access a range of unique identifiers that represent different Census Tracts. These identifiers help to distinguish specific areas for analysis or data processing related to electric vehicle data.For example, if you wanted to filter or group electric vehicle data based on different Census Tracts, you could retrieve the possible values from this endpoint. Each string value corresponds to a distinct Census Tract, allowing you to understand and categorize electric vehicle usage in different geographic regions.This endpoint provides a convenient way to explore and manipulate electric vehicle data based on Census Tract information, enabling you to gain insights into the distribution and patterns of electric vehicle adoption across various areas.

api_list.name: /modelYear
api_list.description: The 'modelYear' endpoint from the 'ElectricVehicleData' API provides an array of strings representing the various possible values for the 'modelYear' field. This field refers to the specific year in which an electric vehicle model was manufactured. By accessing this endpoint, users can retrieve a comprehensive list of available model years for electric vehicles.This endpoint is incredibly useful for individuals seeking information about the different model years of electric cars. It allows users to explore and identify the range of years in which electric vehicles have been produced. The list of strings returned can be utilized for various purposes, such as filtering and sorting electric vehicle data based on specific model years.For example, if you were building an application to compare electric vehicles based on their model years, you could use this endpoint to populate a dropdown menu with all the available options. This would enable users to easily select and narrow down their search based on a particular model year of interest.In summary, the 'modelYear' endpoint in the 'ElectricVehicleData' API offers an array of strings representing the different model years of electric vehicles, providing valuable information for users researching and categorizing electric car data.

api_list.name: /make
api_list.description: The 'make' endpoint from the ElectricVehicleData API provides a user-friendly way to retrieve a list of all the possible makes of electric vehicles available in their database. The endpoint returns an array of strings, where each string represents a unique make of electric vehicle.For example, if you were to call this endpoint, you might get an array containing values like 'Tesla', 'Nissan', 'Chevrolet', and so on. These values represent the different manufacturers or companies that produce electric vehicles.The 'make' endpoint is helpful when you need to populate a dropdown list or provide users with a selection of electric vehicle makes to choose from. By retrieving the array of make values from this endpoint, you can ensure that the list is always up to date and includes all the available options.The endpoint ensures that the data returned is standardized and consistent, making it easier for developers to integrate it into their applications or websites. It simplifies the process of accessing and presenting information about electric vehicle makes, ultimately enhancing the overall user experience when interacting with electric vehicle data.

api_list.name: /dolVehicleId
api_list.description: The 'dolVehicleId' endpoint in the ElectricVehicleData API provides an array of strings that represents all the possible values for the 'dolVehicleId' field. The 'dolVehicleId' serves as a unique identifier for each electric vehicle in the system. This endpoint allows users to retrieve a comprehensive list of all available 'dolVehicleId' values.The 'dolVehicleId' is a key attribute that helps in identifying and distinguishing individual electric vehicles within the ElectricVehicleData system. By accessing this endpoint, users can obtain an array of strings containing a wide range of 'dolVehicleId' values representing various electric vehicles.This endpoint is particularly useful when users need to gather information or perform actions specific to certain electric vehicles. By utilizing the 'dolVehicleId' endpoint, users can obtain an up-to-date and complete list of all 'dolVehicleId' values available in the system, enabling seamless integration and utilization of electric vehicle data throughout their applications or systems.

api_list.name: /electricRange
api_list.description: The 'electricRange' endpoint is part of the ElectricVehicleData API and provides a user-friendly way to retrieve information about the electric range of vehicles. When you make a request to this endpoint, you will receive an array of strings that represent the possible values for the electric range field.The electric range refers to the distance that an electric vehicle can travel on a fully charged battery. This endpoint allows you to explore a range of values that indicate the potential distances an electric vehicle can cover. The values in the array will vary depending on the specific electric vehicles in the database.For instance, if you are interested in knowing the electric range options for different electric vehicles, you can make a request to this endpoint and receive a list of strings such as '300 miles', '150 kilometers', or '80 miles'. Each string represents a specific electric range value that corresponds to a different vehicle model.This endpoint is valuable for individuals who are considering purchasing an electric vehicle and want to compare the electric range capabilities of different models. It provides an easily accessible and comprehensive range of electric range values to assist in decision-making.
